PATIENT_ID: TEST_PELVIC_NC_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-25 06:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-25 06:10:00
Category I activation for 40-year-old male. Motorcycle collision.
Pelvic fracture suspected. Pelvic ring injury on exam.
BP 78/44, HR 142, RR 28, GCS 13.
Hemodynamic instability with pelvic source. Hypotension refractory.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-25 06:25:00
Pelvic x-ray: unstable pelvic ring disruption.
Pubic symphysis diastasis 4 cm. Sacral fracture displaced.
CT pelvis confirmed unstable pattern. Pelvic CT confirms instability.
No gross hematuria on catheter placement. No urologic injury.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-25 06:20:00
No pelvic binder applied. Binder not applied on arrival.
Pelvic binder not placed despite hemodynamic instability and unstable fracture.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-25 06:40:00
Unstable pelvic ring disruption with hemorrhagic shock.
Massive transfusion initiated. Pelvic binder not applied.
Patient taken to angiography suite without binder placement.
